original: @134b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @134b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: badzra t'a ra s'a dha nam /
analyzed: badzra t'a ra s'a dha nam /
translated: Vajratārāsādhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: rdo rje sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs /
analyzed: rdo rje sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs /
translated: The Means of Achievement of Vajra-Tārā

original: 'phags ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Noble Tārā.

original: sbyin sreg las kyi cho ga yis//
analyzed: sbyin sreg las kyi cho ga yis//
translated: By the rite of the fire sacrifice,

original: 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub byed pa'i //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub byed pa'i //
translated: accomplishing all desired aims,

original: rdo rje sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs 'di //
analyzed: rdo rje sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs 'di //
translated: this means of achievement of Vajra-Tārā

original: de nas yang dag bshad par bya //
analyzed: de nas yang dag bshad par bya //
translated: I will now explain again.

original: de la sngags kyi tshig ni 'di rnams su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la sngags kyi tshig ni 'di rnams su 'gyur te /
translated: The words of the mantra are as follows:

original: na ma a'ary'a ba lo ki te shva r'a ya bo dhi satv'a ya ma h'a satv'a ya /
analyzed: na ma a'ary'a ba lo ki te shva r'a ya bo dhi satv'a ya ma h'a satv'a ya /
translated: Homage to the Noble One, the Lord who looks with compassion, the Bodhisattva, the Great Being.

original: ma h'a k'a ru ni k'a ya /
analyzed: ma h'a k'a ru ni k'a ya /
translated: To the Greatly Compassionate One.

original: tadya th'a / aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re sarba dusht'am ma ma kri te dzambha ya stam bha ya mo ha ya bandha ya /
analyzed: tadya th'a / aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re sarba dusht'am ma ma kri te dzambha ya stam bha ya mo ha ya bandha ya /
translated: Tadyathā: Oṃ tāre tuttāre ture sarvaduṣṭān māraya kṛṭaṃ jaṃbhaya staṃbhaya mohaya bandhaya.

original: h'um h'um h'um phat phat phat sarba dusht'am stam bha ni t'a re sv'a h'a /
analyzed: h'um h'um h'um phat phat phat sarba dusht'am stam bha ni t'a re sv'a h'a /
translated: Hum hum hum phaṭ phaṭ phaṭ sarvaduṣṭān stambhanī tāre svāhā.

original: de la dang po re zhig rang gi snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la t'am yig gi sa bon bsgom par byas nas /
analyzed: de la dang po re zhig rang gi snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la t'am yig gi sa bon bsgom par byas nas /
translated: First, one should meditate on the seed syllable TAM in the center of a moon disk in one’s heart.

original: de'i 'od zer gyis bla ma dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams spyan drangs te /
analyzed: de'i 'od zer gyis bla ma dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams spyan drangs te /
translated: Then, one should invite the gurus, buddhas, and bodhisattvas with light rays.

original: sna tshogs pa'i mchod pa rnams kyis yang dag par mchod nas sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa byas te /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i mchod pa rnams kyis yang dag par mchod nas sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa byas te /
translated: Having made perfect offerings with various offerings, one should confess one’s sins, and so forth.

original: gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i tshig bcad brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i tshig bcad brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should recite the words of going for refuge to the Three Jewels.

original: de nas tshad med pa'i gnas bzhi bsgom par byas nas /🔽aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: de nas tshad med pa'i gnas bzhi bsgom par byas nas / aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Then, having meditated on the four immeasurables,

original: zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: one should recite:🔽Oṃ śūnyatā-jñāna-vajra-svabhāvātmako ’haṃ.

original: de nas pam yig las skyes pa'i //
analyzed: de nas pam yig las skyes pa'i //
translated: Then, from the seed syllable PAM,

original: padma zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: padma zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: there is a lotus and a moon disk.

original: slar yang sa bon t'am yig bsgom //
analyzed: slar yang sa bon t'am yig bsgom //
translated: Again, one should meditate on the seed syllable TAM.

original: de nyid yongs su gyur pa las //🔽ma mo'i dbus su bzhugs pa yi //
analyzed: de nyid yongs su gyur pa las // ma mo'i dbus su bzhugs pa yi //
translated: From that very thing🔽in the center of the mother,

original: yum gyur lha mo sgrol ma bsgom //
analyzed: yum gyur lha mo sgrol ma bsgom //
translated: one should meditate on the goddess Tārā, the mother.

original: zhal bzhi phyag ni brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: zhal bzhi phyag ni brgyad pa ste /
translated: He has four faces and eight arms,

original: rgyan rnams kun gyis brgyan gyur pa //
analyzed: rgyan rnams kun gyis brgyan gyur pa //
translated: and is adorned with all the ornaments.

original: sku mdog gser gyi 'od 'bar ba'i ;
analyzed: sku mdog gser gyi 'od 'bar ba'i ;
translated: His body is the color of blazing gold,

original: / gzhon nu ma yi mtshan nyid can //🔽sna tshogs padma la gnas pa'i //
analyzed: / gzhon nu ma yi mtshan nyid can // sna tshogs padma la gnas pa'i //
translated: and he has the characteristics of a youth.🔽He stands upon a variegated lotus,

original: zla ba'i gdan la yang dag bzhugs //
analyzed: zla ba'i gdan la yang dag bzhugs //
translated: upon a seat of the moon.

original: ser dang gnag dang dkar dang dmar //
analyzed: ser dang gnag dang dkar dang dmar //
translated: Yellow, black, white, and red

original: g-yas skor gyi ni zhal bzhi'o //
analyzed: g-yas skor gyi ni zhal bzhi'o //
translated: are the four faces, turning to the right.

original: zhal ni so sor spyan gsum ste //
analyzed: zhal ni so sor spyan gsum ste //
translated: Each face has three eyes,

original: rdo rje skyil mo krung gis bzhugs //
analyzed: rdo rje skyil mo krung gis bzhugs //
translated: and he sits in the vajra posture.

original: dbu rgyan 'od dmar sangs rgyas bzhi //
analyzed: dbu rgyan 'od dmar sangs rgyas bzhi //
translated: The crown ornament is the four red-light Buddhas,

original: rdo rje mda' dung mchog sbyin rnams //
analyzed: rdo rje mda' dung mchog sbyin rnams //
translated: the vajra, arrow, conch, and boon-granting gestures.

original: g-yas kyi phyag na bsnams pa'o //🔽autpal gzhu dang rdo rje yi //
analyzed: g-yas kyi phyag na bsnams pa'o // autpal gzhu dang rdo rje yi //
translated: He holds these in his right hands.🔽The lotus, bow, vajra,

original: lcags kyu rdo rje zhags pa dang // sdigs mdzub g-yon gyi phyag na bsnams //
analyzed: lcags kyu rdo rje zhags pa dang // sdigs mdzub g-yon gyi phyag na bsnams //
translated: and goad, vajra noose, threatening gesture, and vajra🔽he holds in his left hands.

original: rdo rje skyil krung rnal 'byor gyis //
analyzed: rdo rje skyil krung rnal 'byor gyis //
translated: By the yoga of the vajra posture,

original: sa gsum po ni bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: sa gsum po ni bsgrub par bya //
translated: one should accomplish the three worlds.

original: de mdun me tog sgrol ma ni //
analyzed: de mdun me tog sgrol ma ni //
translated: In front of him is Flower Tara,🔽white in color,

original: sku mdog dkar zhing @135a * //🔽yid 'ong ma //
analyzed: sku mdog dkar zhing @135a * //🔽yid 'ong ma //
translated: and beautiful.

original: aom yig rnam pa las skyes pa'i //
analyzed: aom yig rnam pa las skyes pa'i //
translated: Born from the syllable Oṃ,

original: me tog phreng ba phyag na bsnams //
analyzed: me tog phreng ba phyag na bsnams //
translated: she holds a garland of flowers in her hand.

original: zhal gcig phyag ni gnyis ma ste //
analyzed: zhal gcig phyag ni gnyis ma ste //
translated: She has one face and two arms,

original: rgyan rnams kun gyis rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: rgyan rnams kun gyis rnam par brgyan //
translated: and is adorned with all the ornaments.

original: lho ru bdug spos sgrol ma ni //
analyzed: lho ru bdug spos sgrol ma ni //
translated: In the south, Dhūpā Tārā

original: sku mdog nag mo gzugs mdzes ma //
analyzed: sku mdog nag mo gzugs mdzes ma //
translated: is dark-colored and beautiful,

original: rgyan rnams kun gyis mdzes pa yi //
analyzed: rgyan rnams kun gyis mdzes pa yi //
translated: adorned with all the ornaments,

original: phyag na spos kyi snod bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: phyag na spos kyi snod bsnams pa'o //
translated: holding an incense vessel in her hand.

original: nub tu mar me'i sgrol ma ni //🔽sku mdog ser mo yid 'ong ma //
analyzed: nub tu mar me'i sgrol ma ni // sku mdog ser mo yid 'ong ma //
translated: In the west, Dīpa Tārā🔽is yellow-colored and delightful,

original: gser gyi rna rgyan g-yo bas mdzes //
analyzed: gser gyi rna rgyan g-yo bas mdzes //
translated: adorned with moving golden earrings,

original: phyag na mar me'i sdong bu bsnams //
analyzed: phyag na mar me'i sdong bu bsnams //
translated: holding a lamp wick in her hand.

original: byang du dri yi sgrol ma ni //
analyzed: byang du dri yi sgrol ma ni //
translated: In the north, Gandhā Tārā

original: phyag na dri yi dung chos bsnams //
analyzed: phyag na dri yi dung chos bsnams //
translated: holds a conch of scented water in her hand.

original: lha mo sku mdog dmar zhing 'bar //
analyzed: lha mo sku mdog dmar zhing 'bar //
translated: The goddess is red and blazing,

original: snying po'i dkyil 'khor la bsgom bya //
analyzed: snying po'i dkyil 'khor la bsgom bya //
translated: to be contemplated in the heart maṇḍala.

original: 'di rnams zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma //
analyzed: 'di rnams zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma //
translated: These have one face and two arms,

original: rgyan rnams kun gyis rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: rgyan rnams kun gyis rnam par brgyan //
translated: adorned with all the ornaments,

original: rdo rje skyil krung gis bzhugs ma //
analyzed: rdo rje skyil krung gis bzhugs ma //
translated: seated in vajra posture.

original: lha mo lnga po 'di rnams ni //
analyzed: lha mo lnga po 'di rnams ni //
translated: These five goddesses

original: cung zad zhal ni gtsigs pa ste //
analyzed: cung zad zhal ni gtsigs pa ste //
translated: slightly baring his fangs,

original: rol pa'i stabs kyis yang dag bzhugs //
analyzed: rol pa'i stabs kyis yang dag bzhugs //
translated: standing in the dancing posture.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo thams cad bsams la /
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo thams cad bsams la /
translated: Having thus visualized the entire mandala circle,

original: rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis ye shes kyi 'khor lo gdan drangs la /
analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis ye shes kyi 'khor lo gdan drangs la /
translated: one should invite the wisdom circle with light rays from the seed syllable in one's heart.

original: dza:h'um bam ho:zhes pas 'dir dgug pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: dza:h'um bam ho:zhes pas 'dir dgug pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: With Jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ, one should summon and so forth here.

original: de nas shar sgor bsgom bya ste //🔽rdo rje lcags kyu 'od dkar mo //
analyzed: de nas shar sgor bsgom bya ste // rdo rje lcags kyu 'od dkar mo //
translated: Then one should meditate on the eastern door,🔽the white Vajra Hook,

original: rdo rje lcags kyu'i phyag mtshan ma //
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu'i phyag mtshan ma //
translated: having the insignia of a hook in her hand,

original: shin tu yid 'ong bdag nyid do //
analyzed: shin tu yid 'ong bdag nyid do //
translated: with a delightful nature.

original: lho sgor rdo rje zhags pa ma //
analyzed: lho sgor rdo rje zhags pa ma //
translated: At the southern door, Vajra noose,

original: shin tu 'dod dga' sku mdog gnag / gzugs mdzes rgyan gyis brgyan pa ste //🔽rdo rje zhags pa 'chang ba'i mchog / nub sgor rdo rje lcags sgrog ma //
analyzed: shin tu 'dod dga' sku mdog gnag / gzugs mdzes rgyan gyis brgyan pa ste // rdo rje zhags pa 'chang ba'i mchog / nub sgor rdo rje lcags sgrog ma //
translated: very desirable, with a dark-colored body, beautiful form, adorned with ornaments,🔽holding the supreme vajra noose.🔽At the western door, Vajra Shackles,

original: byag na rdo rje lcags sgrog bsnams //
analyzed: byag na rdo rje lcags sgrog bsnams //
translated: holding a vajra shackle in her hand,

original: sna tshogs rgyan gyis brgyan pa ste //
analyzed: sna tshogs rgyan gyis brgyan pa ste //
translated: adorned with various ornaments,

original: sku mdog ser mo bsam par bya //
analyzed: sku mdog ser mo bsam par bya //
translated: one should visualize a yellow-colored body.

original: byang sgor rdo rje dril bu ma //
analyzed: byang sgor rdo rje dril bu ma //
translated: At the northern gate is Vajraghanta.🔽Vajrapani holds a supreme bell,

original: phyag na rdo rje dril bu mchog / shin tu gzugs mdzes kha dog dmar //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje dril bu mchog / shin tu gzugs mdzes kha dog dmar //
translated: very beautiful, with a red complexion.

original: bzang mo'i gzugs ni blta bar bya //
analyzed: bzang mo'i gzugs ni blta bar bya //
translated: One should visualize the form of Bhadra.

original: steng du gtsug tor rnam rgyal ma //
analyzed: steng du gtsug tor rnam rgyal ma //
translated: Above is Uṣṇīṣavijayā,

original: gzugs mdzes sku mdog ser mo ste //
analyzed: gzugs mdzes sku mdog ser mo ste //
translated: beautiful, with a yellow complexion,

original: byang chub 'bras bu sbyin mdzad ma //
analyzed: byang chub 'bras bu sbyin mdzad ma //
translated: bestowing the fruit of enlightenment.

original: sngags pas 'khor lo 'dzin ma bsgom //
analyzed: sngags pas 'khor lo 'dzin ma bsgom //
translated: The mantrin should visualize Cakradhara.

original: de nas snying po'i dkyil 'khor 'og /
analyzed: de nas snying po'i dkyil 'khor 'og /
translated: Then, below the essence maṇḍala,

original: dge zhing 'od zer 'bar ba'i gzugs //
analyzed: dge zhing 'od zer 'bar ba'i gzugs //
translated: the virtuous one, with a blazing form,

original: sbrul gyi zhags pa phyag na bsnams //
analyzed: sbrul gyi zhags pa phyag na bsnams //
translated: holds a noose of snakes in her hand.

original: sku mdog nag mo bsgom par bya //
analyzed: sku mdog nag mo bsgom par bya //
translated: One should visualize the black-complexioned one.

original: zhal gcig phyag ni gnyis pa ste //
analyzed: zhal gcig phyag ni gnyis pa ste //
translated: She has one face and two arms,

original: shes bya kun mkhyen yin 'ong ma //🔽yi ge bu po 'di rnams kyis //
analyzed: shes bya kun mkhyen yin 'ong ma // yi ge bu po 'di rnams kyis //
translated: and is omniscient with respect to all objects of knowledge.🔽With these ten syllables

original: lha mo bcu ni rnams par sprul //
analyzed: lha mo bcu ni rnams par sprul //
translated: the ten goddesses are emanated.

original: pa rol phyin bcu dag pa ste /
analyzed: pa rol phyin bcu dag pa ste /
translated: The ten perfections are purified,

original: las kun rab tu @135b 'grub par byed //
analyzed: las kun rab tu @135b 'grub par byed //
translated: and all activities are accomplished.

original: de la yi ge bcu rnams ni //
analyzed: de la yi ge bcu rnams ni //
translated: The ten syllables are:

original: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ tāre tuttāre ture svāhā.

original: de bzhin du skur dang gsung dang thugs byin gyis brlab pa dang // dbang bskur ba dang // thig le dang / phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang / bzlas pa la sogs pa dang / bsgom par yang bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du skur dang gsung dang thugs byin gyis brlab pa dang // dbang bskur ba dang // thig le dang / phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang / bzlas pa la sogs pa dang / bsgom par yang bya'o zhes so //
translated: Likewise, one should perform the consecration of body, speech, and mind, the conferral of initiation, the yoga of the drop, the subtle yoga, the repetition of mantra, and so on.

original: sngags mchog 'di ni gtso bo ste //
analyzed: sngags mchog 'di ni gtso bo ste //
translated: This supreme mantra is the chief,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyis phyag byas pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyis phyag byas pa //
translated: it is the one worshipped by all the Buddhas,

original: bklags pa yis ni dngos grub byed //
analyzed: bklags pa yis ni dngos grub byed //
translated: it is the one that brings about the attainment just by being recited,

original: gsal por rdo rje gur las gsungs //
analyzed: gsal por rdo rje gur las gsungs //
translated: it is clearly taught in the Vajra Tent.

original: zhes so // de la 'dir nye bar spyod pa ni sngags 'dis gos kyi sna la bzung nas lan bdun du bsngags shing mdud pa byas na 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i sa gang du 'gro yang 'jigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes so // de la 'dir nye bar spyod pa ni sngags 'dis gos kyi sna la bzung nas lan bdun du bsngags shing mdud pa byas na 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i sa gang du 'gro yang 'jigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the service is as follows: If one holds the end of one's garment with this mantra, incants it seven times, and ties it, then wherever one goes, even to a fearful place, one will not be afraid.

original: stag dang / chom po dang / chu srin dang / seng ge dang / sbrul dang / glang po che dang / ma he dang / dom dang / ba lang dang / rta la sogs pas gnod bar mi byed do //
analyzed: stag dang / chom po dang / chu srin dang / seng ge dang / sbrul dang / glang po che dang / ma he dang / dom dang / ba lang dang / rta la sogs pas gnod bar mi byed do //
translated: One will not be harmed by tigers, thieves, crocodiles, lions, snakes, elephants, buffaloes, bears, cows, horses, and so on.

original: de bzhin du sngags 'dis autpa la la brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas nas sbyin sreg bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags 'dis autpa la la brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas nas sbyin sreg bya ste /
translated: Likewise, one should recite this mantra one hundred and eight times over an utpala flower and offer it in the fire.

original: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re aa mu ki me ba sha ma n'a ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re aa mu ki me ba sha ma n'a ya sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ tāre tuttāre ture amukīṃ me vaśaṃ naya svāhā.

original: zhes pas gang 'dod pa de dbang du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pas gang 'dod pa de dbang du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whomever one desires will be brought under one’s control.

original: de bzhin du sngags 'dis bya rog gi sgrol la lan sum cu rtsa gnyis bzlas te dgra bo'i khang par sbas na nyi ma bdun gyis skrod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags 'dis bya rog gi sgrol la lan sum cu rtsa gnyis bzlas te dgra bo'i khang par sbas na nyi ma bdun gyis skrod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, one should recite this mantra thirty-two times over a crow’s feather and hide it in the house of one’s enemy. In seven days, the enemy will be expelled.

original: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re tsal pra tsa la sh'i ghram mi ni de ba datta autsatsha ta ya h'um phat ces pa ni bskrad pa'i cho ga'o ;
analyzed: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re tsal pra tsa la sh'i ghram mi ni de ba datta autsatsha ta ya h'um phat ces pa ni bskrad pa'i cho ga'o ;
translated: Oṃ tāre tuttāre ture calapracāla śīghraṃ minan devadat tārayā hūṃ phaṭ. This is the expulsion rite.

original: / de nas gzhan la sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: / de nas gzhan la sbyor ba ni /
translated: Next, the application to others is as follows.

original: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re aa mu k'a bhi dh'a n'am ku m'a r'i ma hya mud b'a he na ta sy'a:bi t'a bra yatstshantu sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re aa mu k'a bhi dh'a n'am ku m'a r'i ma hya mud b'a he na ta sy'a:bi t'a bra yatstshantu sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ tāre tuttāre ture amukā nāma kumārī mahāmudrāvahe nayatasyāḥ prāṇān ākarṣaya svāhā.

original: myos byed ga tum po'i sa bon dang // myos byed 'bras bu de bzhin du //
analyzed: myos byed ga tum po'i sa bon dang // myos byed 'bras bu de bzhin du //
translated: and likewise the fruit of the intoxicating gaḍu,

original: mya ngan med shing me tog bcas //
analyzed: mya ngan med shing me tog bcas //
translated: the flower of the aśoka tree,

original: sbyin sreg stong phrag lnga byas te //
analyzed: sbyin sreg stong phrag lnga byas te //
translated: having performed five thousand homa offerings,

original: mar sbrang bu ram sbyin sreg ni //
analyzed: mar sbrang bu ram sbyin sreg ni //
translated: the homa offering of ghee, honey, and molasses,

original: bu mo sgrub la mchog tu bsngags //
analyzed: bu mo sgrub la mchog tu bsngags //
translated: is highly recommended for the attainment of a girl.

original: de nas zhig bdun sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: de nas zhig bdun sbyor ba yis //
translated: Then, by the union of the two for seven days,

original: rang 'dod bu mo thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: rang 'dod bu mo thob par 'gyur //
translated: one will obtain the girl one desires.

original: de nas gzhan la rab tu sbyor ba ni //
analyzed: de nas gzhan la rab tu sbyor ba ni //
translated: Next, the application to others:

original: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re aa mu k'a bhi dh'a n'am svastha'a na ta a'a karsha ya ma m'anti ke dza:zhes pa'i sngags 'dis rgya shug gi tsher ma la stong phrag lnga rang byung gi me tog la bsnyugs nas sbyin sreg byas nas 'dis rgyal po'i bu
analyzed: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re aa mu k'a bhi dh'a n'am svastha'a na ta a'a karsha ya ma m'anti ke dza:zhes pa'i sngags 'dis rgya shug gi tsher ma la stong phrag lnga rang byung gi me tog la bsnyugs nas sbyin sreg byas nas 'dis rgyal po'i bu
translated: With the mantra Oṃ tāre tuttāre ture, draw to me so-and-so, who is under my control, jaḥ, having smeared five thousand jujube thorns with natural flowers, one should perform the homa. By this, even the daughter of a king

original: mo yang 'gugs par byed do //
analyzed: mo yang 'gugs par byed do //
translated: will be summoned.

original: de nas gzhan la yang rab tu sbyor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas gzhan la yang rab tu sbyor bar 'gyur te /
translated: Next, the application to others will occur:

original: rang / byung gi me tog gis bskul ba'i ras la bcom ldan 'das ma zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma lcags kyu dang autpa la'i zhags pa phyag gnyis na bsnams pa bris la //
analyzed: rang / byung gi me tog gis bskul ba'i ras la bcom ldan 'das ma zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma lcags kyu dang autpa la'i zhags pa phyag gnyis na bsnams pa bris la //
translated: On a cloth inspired by the flowers of one's own season, draw the Blessed Lady with one face and two hands, holding an iron hook and an utpala-entwined noose in her two hands.🔽

original: lha rdzas me @136a * //🔽tog dam pa 'di //
analyzed: lha rdzas me @136a * // tog dam pa 'di //
translated: On a cloth that has been stimulated by the flower of one's own sexual organ, draw the Blessed Lady with one face and two arms, holding an iron hook and an utpala with a noose, with the words This excellent divine flower and so forth.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas de'i mdun du mchod pa byas te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas de'i mdun du mchod pa byas te /
translated: Having made offerings in front of her,

original: bsgom pa dang ldan pas sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa dang ldan pas sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: one who possesses meditation should recite the mantra.

original: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re aa mu k'i ma me pa tsi tam sva pnam ka th'a ya h'um phat /
analyzed: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re aa mu k'i ma me pa tsi tam sva pnam ka th'a ya h'um phat /
translated: Om tare tuttare ture amuka im me vacanam karthayah hum phat.

original: stong phrag lngas 'ong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: stong phrag lngas 'ong bar 'gyur te /
translated: By five thousand [recitations], she will come.

original: zhags pas mgul pa bcings shing lcags kyus phug la autpal gyis rkang pa bcings te /
analyzed: zhags pas mgul pa bcings shing lcags kyus phug la autpal gyis rkang pa bcings te /
translated: Having bound her neck with a noose, pierced her with an iron hook, and bound her feet with an utpala,

original: bsgrub bya bkug nas rkang pa'i 'og tu bsams nas bran mo'i gzugs kyis longs spyod par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya bkug nas rkang pa'i 'og tu bsams nas bran mo'i gzugs kyis longs spyod par bya'o //
translated: having summoned the victim, one should enjoy her in the form of a servant girl, imagining her under one's feet.

original: de nas gzhan la rab tu sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: de nas gzhan la rab tu sbyor ba ni /
translated: Then, the application to others is:

original: sgrol ma'i gzungs lan bdun du mngon par bsngags nas bdag nyid kyi mig gnyis la byugs nas rgyal po'i rigs kyi nang du zhugs na rgyal po dang bcas pas bla ma la sogs par byed cing gcig tu dbang du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrol ma'i gzungs lan bdun du mngon par bsngags nas bdag nyid kyi mig gnyis la byugs nas rgyal po'i rigs kyi nang du zhugs na rgyal po dang bcas pas bla ma la sogs par byed cing gcig tu dbang du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having enchanted the Dhīḥ mantra of Tārā seven times, one should anoint one's own two eyes and enter into the presence of the king. He and his court will honor one as a guru and will be completely subjugated.

original: de nas gzhan la rab tu sbyor ba ni sgrol ma'i gzungs lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la sprul gdong gnyis pa'i mgo thal bar byas te ba dmar mo'i mar la aarka'i bal la sdong bu byas te rab tu sbar te mig sman bsag par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gzhan la rab tu sbyor ba ni sgrol ma'i gzungs lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la sprul gdong gnyis pa'i mgo thal bar byas te ba dmar mo'i mar la aarka'i bal la sdong bu byas te rab tu sbar te mig sman bsag par bya'o //
translated: Then, the application to others: having enchanted the Dhīḥ mantra of Tārā one hundred and eight times, one should grind the head of a two-headed snake into red cow butter, make a wick with Arka cotton, light it, and collect the eye medicine.

original: de'i mig sman dang / rdo rje nyi ma dang / rdo rje chos dag yang dag par mnyes la rta mchog gis bdug par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mig sman dang / rdo rje nyi ma dang / rdo rje chos dag yang dag par mnyes la rta mchog gis bdug par bya'o //
translated: One should please the eye medicine, the Vajra Sun, and the Vajra Dharma, and fumigate with Uḍupatra.

original: de'i thal ba dang lhan cig tu mig sman mig la bskus na gang la rdo rje'i mig gis bltas pa de'i padma gar gyi dbang phyug 'dzag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i thal ba dang lhan cig tu mig sman mig la bskus na gang la rdo rje'i mig gis bltas pa de'i padma gar gyi dbang phyug 'dzag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having anointed one's eyes with the eye medicine together with the ashes, whoever is seen with the vajra eye will have their lotus Nāṭyeśvara drip.

original: de ltar ma gyur na sgrol ma bdag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nges par bslus pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ma gyur na sgrol ma bdag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nges par bslus pa yin no //
translated: If it does not happen like this, I, Tārā, have certainly deceived the Blessed Buddha.

original: de nas gzhan la sbyor ba ni lto ba'i srin bu la sgrol ma'i gzungs kyis lan bdun du mngon par bsngags nas rdo rje chos dang lhan cig tu byas te /
analyzed: de nas gzhan la sbyor ba ni lto ba'i srin bu la sgrol ma'i gzungs kyis lan bdun du mngon par bsngags nas rdo rje chos dang lhan cig tu byas te /
translated: Then, the application to others: Having enchanted seven times with the Tārā dhāraṇī the intestinal worm, together with Vajradharma,

original: de so rtsi dang sbyar la sbyin no //
analyzed: de so rtsi dang sbyar la sbyin no //
translated: one should give it.

original: bya ba byed cing sbyor ba'i mchog 'dis mi gtong ste /
analyzed: bya ba byed cing sbyor ba'i mchog 'dis mi gtong ste /
translated: One should not abandon this supreme application, which is the performance of the action.

original: rang gi chung ma bzhin du spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽de las gzhan la rab tu sbyor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi chung ma bzhin du spyod par 'gyur ro // de las gzhan la rab tu sbyor bar 'gyur te /
translated: One will enjoy it like one’s own wife.

original: so ma skyes pa'i bu chung gi lce blangs te sgrol ma'i gzungs lan bdun du mngon par bsngags te bhring+ga r'a dza dang / gi wang dang lhan cig tu byas te dpral bar thig le byas na gang la bltas pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so ma skyes pa'i bu chung gi lce blangs te sgrol ma'i gzungs lan bdun du mngon par bsngags te bhring+ga r'a dza dang / gi wang dang lhan cig tu byas te dpral bar thig le byas na gang la bltas pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: One should apply it to others: Having taken the tongue of a young child who died a natural death, enchanted it seven times with the Tārā dhāraṇī, and made it together with bhrṅgarāja and costus root, one should make a bindu on the forehead. Whoever one looks at will be enthralled.

original: de nas gzhan la yang rab tu sbyor ba ni zhag chen po rang gi lus la byugs te bsgoms pa dang lhan cig pas sgrol ma'i gzungs khri tsho gcig bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas gzhan la yang rab tu sbyor ba ni zhag chen po rang gi lus la byugs te bsgoms pa dang lhan cig pas sgrol ma'i gzungs khri tsho gcig bzlas par bya ste /
translated: Then, the application to others is that one should anoint one's body with the great urine, and together with the meditation, one should recite the Tara mantra one hundred thousand times.

original: bzlas pa'i mthar 'bras s'a lu'i zan gyis dril phyis byas la dril phyis de bsdus te gang la byin pa de ji srid 'tsho'i bar du dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzlas pa'i mthar 'bras s'a lu'i zan gyis dril phyis byas la dril phyis de bsdus te gang la byin pa de ji srid 'tsho'i bar du dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: At the end of the recitation, one should make a paste with rice flour, and one should gather that paste and give it to whomever, and they will be under one's power for as long as one lives.

original: de nas gzhan la rab tu sbyor @136b ba ni zla ba gzas zin pa'i dus su sgrol ma'i gzungs bzlas shing bsnyen pa byas la /
analyzed: de nas gzhan la rab tu sbyor @136b ba ni zla ba gzas zin pa'i dus su sgrol ma'i gzungs bzlas shing bsnyen pa byas la /
translated: Then, the application to others is that at the time of the moon's eclipse, one should recite the Tara mantra and perform the familiarization.

original: de las byung ba'i 'jig rten dbang phyug gis dung gi phye ma sbang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i 'jig rten dbang phyug gis dung gi phye ma sbang bar bya'o //
translated: From that, one should grind the conch powder with the arisen Lokeśvara.

original: de gang la byin pa de ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gang la byin pa de ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: One should give that to whomever, and they will follow for as long as one lives.

original: gzhan yang rab tu sbyor ba ni sgrol ma'i gzungs myos byed kyi 'bras bu la lan brgya rtsa brgyad yongs su bzlas te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab tu sbyor ba ni sgrol ma'i gzungs myos byed kyi 'bras bu la lan brgya rtsa brgyad yongs su bzlas te /
translated: Moreover, the application is that one should recite the Tara mantra on the fruit of the madana tree one hundred and eight times.

original: 'bras bu rdo rje rta mgrin dang lhan cig tu byas te byugs na de dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu rdo rje rta mgrin dang lhan cig tu byas te byugs na de dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one anoints the genitals of a woman with the fruit of the vajra horse-nech together with the ashes, she will be under one’s control.

original: gzhan yang rab tu sbyor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab tu sbyor bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, there is another application:

original: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re aa mu k'a sya bandh'a na muktim ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re aa mu k'a sya bandh'a na muktim ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: “Oṃ tāre tuttāre ture, liberate the bonds of so-and-so, svāhā.”

original: sngags 'dis aarka'i lo ma la bsgrub bya'i ming bar du bcug ste bris nas sdig pa'i tshang du sbas na /
analyzed: sngags 'dis aarka'i lo ma la bsgrub bya'i ming bar du bcug ste bris nas sdig pa'i tshang du sbas na /
translated: With this mantra, one writes the name of the person to be liberated in the middle on an arka leaf, and buries it in a crow’s nest.

original: bcings pa las grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcings pa las grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be liberated from bondage.

original: rdo rje sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
analyzed: rdo rje sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
translated: The sādhana of Vajratārā is complete.
